SENT.plain: Behçet's disease is a multisystemic vasculitis characterized by the association of recurrent oral and genital ulcers with systemic involvements, particularly ocular, nervous and vascular manifestations
The association of Behçet's disease and aids/HIV infection is rare
The role of HIV infection in the pathomechanism of both diseases is unclear
We report a 28-year-old HIV-positive patient who presented Behçet's disease complicated by deep vein thrombosis and left lateral sinus thrombosis
This rare association raises questions about the etiopathogenic process and therapeutic management
